solution_line_template: Whitney is buying {num_posters} posters for ${cost_per_poster} each, so the posters will cost {num_posters}*${cost_per_poster}= $<<{num_posters}*{cost_per_poster}={total_cost_posters}>>{total_cost_posters} total cost for posters.

Whitney is buying {num_notebooks} notebooks for ${cost_per_notebook} each, so the notebooks will cost {num_notebooks}*${cost_per_notebook}= $<<{num_notebooks}*{cost_per_notebook}={total_cost_notebooks}>>{total_cost_notebooks} total cost for notebooks.

Whitney is buying {num_bookmarks} notebooks for ${cost_per_bookmark}, so the bookmarks {num_bookmarks}*${cost_per_bookmark}= $<<{num_bookmarks}*{cost_per_bookmark}={total_cost_bookmarks}>>{total_cost_bookmarks} total cost for bookmarks.

Since Whitney is paying ${total_cost_posters} for posters, ${total_cost_notebooks} for notebooks, and ${total_cost_bookmarks} for bookmarks, her total purchase will cost ${total_cost_posters}+${total_cost_notebooks}+${total_cost_bookmarks}= $<<{total_cost_posters}+{total_cost_notebooks}+{total_cost_bookmarks}={total_purchase_cost}>>{total_purchase_cost} total purchase cost.

Whitney’s mom gave her {num_bills} ${bill_denomination} bills, so she will be paying with {num_bills}*${bill_denomination}=$<<{num_bills}*{bill_denomination}={total_payment}>>{total_payment} total payment.

Since Whitney is paying with ${total_payment} and her purchase cost will be ${total_purchase_cost}, she will have ${total_payment}-${total_purchase_cost}= $<<{total_payment}-{total_purchase_cost}={money_left_over}>>{money_left_over} left over after the purchase.
